review: Bought it primarily for its wireless display casting. There are some deceptive advertising that this supports miracast, it doesn't. it does not use wifi direct at all. instead it clogs your network sending what is effectively a VNC view from your device to the dongle, and poorly i have to say. lots of audio sync issues, horrible image rendering, pixelation at it struggles to stream even 720p content...It also suffers from google update syndrome, keep an eye on your settings because it conveniently 'forgets' things when it updates, primarily your privacy configuration..the worst is that you can't do a damn thing with if it can't use the network to contact mama google every time you start it up.the reason is that apps are not stored on the dongle, which is understandable; but casting your screen from a device on the same network is an operation that needs no internet access, but google requires it anyway....FAIL.(note that it can update its firmware but the simple casting application can't reside on the chip? BULLS****)its been out for two years and while google has made updates, and LOTS of folks have complained about this issue on the bug forums, google has shown no interest in changing this requirement..so its going back to the store and netgear push2tv is coming home instead. you give up a lot of control and personal information for that 35 dollar hdmi wart...more than i'm willing to give..
